wikitext.*:
'''Hithui''' was the [[Sindarin]] name for the eleventh month of the year, equivalent to [[Quenya]] [[Hísimë]] and comparable to the [[Shire-hobbits]]' [[Blotmath]] and modern November. Its name comes from the Elvish word for 'mist', and it marked the descent of winter on [[Middle-earth]]. After the beginning of Hithui, no long journeys were attempted in the [[Northlands]] until the arrival of the following spring.<ref>{{App|Calendars}}</ref>
